title: Sylas might be the biggest balance nightmare in the history of League
body:
Forget Azir, Kalista, and any other previous balance nightmare. Sylas will trump them all, many times over.

Over 140 ultimates, ON ONE CHAMP. How do you possibly balance that? 
Some of these ults will be incredibly powerful on top of the rest of his overloaded kit.

Earlier I seen a barely fed Sylas one shot 3 people in one go, with a full ap Malphite ult comboed with his own insane burst.
Now the point i’m trying to make, is the difference between a Malphite ult and Sylas using a Malphite ult, is that Malphite doesn’t have anywhere near as much follow up damage/burst to follow it up with so he generally doesn’t one shot people unless he’s really ahead. This doesn’t apply to Sylas, he can use Malphite ult with plenty of follow up burst, basically breaking the fundamental rules of Malphite’s kit, a champ with barely any follow up burst outside his ult, because his ult is so damn powerful.

Sylas throws that rule out the window, and he will do that with many many other champion’s ultimates.

Not to mention his ult cooldown is 9 seconds at rank 3!! and the rest of his kit is so damn overloaded, he is extremely mobile, with two dashes, has INSANE healing/shielding, an execute, and incredible amounts of aoe/burst

I don't like his Ultimate steal just being a point and click "yoink", there's no risk to it.

Sylas stealing spells is something that is inspired from Rubick in Dota. Explaining Rubick is he had an Ultimate that could steal any spell (not just ultimates); but he only could steal the last ability that the enemy character used.

So when Rubick stole something like a Tidehunter Ultimate (A massive fast AOE stun, think Amumu but way deadlier), he had to carefully plan it, first of all to be outside of the range of that ultimate, second to actually use his spell steal before Tidehunter could spam a different ability to prevent his Ultimate from being stolen. Third to pull off an ability that put him in harms way (Rubick is very squishy)

So when Rubick could steal Ultimates, a lot of the time this was a big play. It was a game-charger and game winner, some of Dota's most iconic moments involve clutch spell-steals. A good Rubick is rewarded for their clever usage of the ability and can turn the tides very suddenly.

With Sylas however, I'm seeing none of that. Sylas will simply choose which Ultimate he wants at little cost. He is encouraged to build tanky and has CC and sustain built into his kit. I know League is a very different game from dota now, but at its heart they are both games about strategy and outplay. Where's the outplay potential with Sylas?

Massive missed opprotunity here. Nobody will be impressed by a tanky champion using his CC and point and clicking ultimates, Rubick is beloved by the dota community. Sylas will be reviled.

Azir and Kalista were balancing nightmares, because they were complex kits, that were hard to balance, in a time where riot actually cared about balance.

It's just us, the people on the boards, who are stuck in an outdated philosophy that doesn't apply to this game anymore.

How exactly is his ult a support ult?

So... It isn't a suport ult because it is not inside the same kit.

it's going to be used the same way Rubick's ult gets used; fishing for the best spell you can snag (CC, but also damage in Sylas's case), which is generally going to mean Sylas will just click on your initiator and get a massive CC+nuke ult that also gets him a way in. Especially if/when it's a tank, because most tanks have very high AP scalings on their ult even though they never use those ratios. Only Riot took out 100% of Rubick's counterplay and gave it to Sylas. 

It's a support ult.

To be fair, Sylas is technically both better and worse than Rubick's spell steal.

Rubick can grab a really good spell regardless of it's an ult or not and hold onto it for several minutes, able to cast it as much as he wants (until death or . Meanwhile, Sylas gets one cast of an ult with a pretty damn long CD until late game.

On paper Sylas is stronger because yes, you always get the BIG MONEY of a kit. However, unlike Rubick, he only gets a singular cast and then a 200% CD (Granted, with CDR reduction) for that singular spell. This conversely means Sylas generally can't steal as many spells as Rubick can and he's always constrained by what he can steal as there's no situation where he can steal an amazing basic ability like any champion's hook, a heal or some absurd self-buff like Wuju style or black shield.

The only thing game breaking about his 9 second ult is that he can use it multiple times in a fight, granted it last long enough for that. It applies an individual cooldown that is 200% of the base Cooldown of the ult stolen. Malphite ult takes damn near 2 minutes to come back, meaning sylas cant use it for another 4.
Runes the lower Ult CD lower this 200% cool down too.

>Over 140 ultimates, ON ONE CHAMP. How do you possibly balance that?

By only giving him five ults a game with no assurance the ults he'll get will be good.

While his PBE numbers are probably overtuned, stealing ults is only going to be as good as the enemy team is.

> stealing ults is only going to be as good as the enemy team is.

I really don't want the counterplay to his ult being pick really bad champions. Especially when you have to factor in your other four team mates choices, that in most cases is out of your control. 

PBE has his kit completely over loaded as well. Why every new champion needs to be able to do everything is beyond me compared to older champions.

Good news: You don't have to!

See, people only see "Sylas steals ult". They don't think of the fact that often, these ults are a capstone/cornerstone of the kit and work within the kit. Take Brand, for example. Stealing pyroclasm seems amazing at a glance....then you remember Sylas doesn't have Brand's passive, which means his pryoclasm is quite a bit less scary than Brands because there's little threat of multiple ignite detonations (Relying on one person being hit three times). It's true of many ults like Syndra, Lux, Darius and more. There are also other ults that get woefully more powerful because of an enemy's kit. Yes, stealing Zed ult seems cool until you realize it gives you bonus AD and you don't have spells that cast as quickly as Zed.

Point is, Sylas ult isn't nearly as strong as people think it will be because PBE is mostly a meme environment with tons of youtubers smashing low ELOs for high quality clickbait vids. Is Sylas's base kit too good? From a numbers perspective it probably is. However, I don't think Sylas ult will be a problem at all save for very rare circumstances where Sylas can jack an ult that is completely kit agnostic such as Malphite ult or Alistar ult.

I think there is a misunderstanding here, to what balance actually refers to. It is not just numbers representing around 50% winrate, it is more the fact that there are available counters to the said champions at every stage of the game. 

So if Sylas being good or bad is dependent on the enemy team composition, he is either going to be really unbearable or vice versa (though since he has the option of stealing between 5 ults per game, plus there being a CD on stealing the same ult), i do think that the times where he will be useless will indeed be very rare, since he is given that flexibility. Unless you actually expect the whole enemy team to choose champs with ults that do not work well with Sylas since their ults rely on other parts of their kit i.e. passives (brand as you said), then i could understand. However, i would expect such an unexpected scenario in pro play and this then takes us back to league ONLY catering to flashy pro plays. Do note, i am not against league trying to gain popularity/profit but at what expense?

I do think that some ults will absolutely be a nightmare on him, regardless of if he was fed or not. The only way to balance him IMO, would be to make the rest of his kit weaker so that he is pretty reliant on being chosen against team comps with good ults that compliment his kit. With his current overloaded kit, i can't see a situation where sylas will be bad.

 It is the same strategy of overbuffing new champs so they are bought in masses  that we have been seeing for years. If by some chance they do not dominate the meta, they are buffed the next patch.

That's why it'll be a balance nightmare. If he could access every ult in every game, that would at least be consistent, but he'll have matches where his ult is almost useless, matches where it's ridiculously OP, and everything in between. It's too unpredictable to actually balance (meaning, neither OP nor UP).
There is no way they will EVER balance this champ.

The easiest way I can think of to balance him is to make the CD on his ult be based of the CD of the ult he stole. For example, if he steals karthus ult, his ult goes on CD for the same base CD as karthus's ult does (applying whatever CDR Sylas has to the base CD of the ult of course). That way if he uses a high power ult that normally is not abusable because of it's long CD, Sylas also gets gated by that CD. Now the coding for that is probably not nearly as simple as I think it is, but that is a problem for someone who actually gets paid to do coding/programming.
The rest of the balancing can be achieved by first waiting to see how Sylas shakes out power wise once people have had some time to learn how to play as, with, and against him then adjusting the base damages and scalings on his basic abilities as needed.
